title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a solid line because the inequality sign is $$ \geq $$.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. \\n $$y \geq \frac{3}{4} x-2$$ \\n $$0 \geq 0\frac{3}{4}-2$$ \\n $$0 \geq -2$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is a solution to $$y \geq \frac{3}{4} x-2$$. Since (0,0) is on the left side of the line, we shade the left side of the boundary line in red.\n##figure4.gif##

title: Graph Second Inequality
text: Graph $$y<2$$ on the same grid. Recognize that it is a horizontal line through $$y=2$$.

title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a dashed line because the inequality sign is <.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. \\n $$y<2$$ \\n $$0<2$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is a solution to $$y<2$$. Since (0,0) is on the bottom side of the line, so we shade in the bottom side of the line $$y=2$$ in green.\n##figure8.gif##

title: Overlap Shading
text: The solution is all points in the darker shaded region.
